channel.title: Jason Aaron on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in Jason Aaron on jverkamp.com

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 6: Out Among the Stars
item.description:
STAR WARS #33-37 Annual #3

So many different stories in this one!

We have the beach episode.

A Lando Calrissian and Sana Starros team upâ€¦

â€¦double (triple? Quadruple?!) cross!

Han (with a weirdly photorealistic face) and Chewie transporting a Hutt:

And R2-D2 on a mission!

Iâ€™d â€¦ forgotten that C-3PO had gotten captured.

And if that wasnâ€™t enough, Scar Squadronâ€”and our favorite Storm Trooper with a lightsaber.

Thatâ€™s still weird to type.

I do enjoy the idea of a Storm Trooper just trying to do the right thingâ€”that doesnâ€™t actually join or even support the Rebellion. Itâ€™s a neat story we havenâ€™t gotten in the movies/TV (that Iâ€™ve seen).

Itâ€™s quite the mix and feels a bit disjoined, but I enjoyed it all well enough. I just was hoping for a bit more closure.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 5: Yoda's Secret War
item.description:
C-3PO has been captured!

And Iâ€™m not sure whoâ€™s the worse off for it. ðŸ˜„

Itâ€™s not entirely clear if Darth Vader recognizes him or not. With as many memory wipes as C-3PO has apparently gone through, itâ€™s worth wondering if heâ€™s still even the same as he was when Anakin first built himâ€¦

But really, in an interesting sort of flip, most of this volume is the backstory! Andâ€”as might be hinted at by the titleâ€”we actually get pre-Prequel era Yoda! And Qui-Gon Jinn. Now I want to read more Qui-Gon Jinn stories. I wonder if thatâ€™s a thing.

Anyways, Yoda on a planet of feralâ€”and force sensitive because of courseâ€”children. Because of course thatâ€™s a story that has to be in the Star Wars canon. It actually gets far more interesting that I expected, but as Star Wars (outside of the movies) seems wont to doâ€¦ things get weird.

Itâ€™s a fascinating story, but again falls a bit into â€˜just how much did Luke do outside of the moviesâ€™ trap that just feels weird.

Onward!

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 4: Last Flight of the Harbinger
item.description:
Two main plots this time: good guys and bad guysâ€”itâ€™s all in your point of view and the Big Three steal something even bigger.

Itâ€™s fascinating how these stories at once seem smaller and more compactâ€”not able to stretch out on the big screenâ€”and at the same time tackle things the movies couldnâ€™t dare to approach in two hours.

Worth a read!

On a side note: how much or how little the artwork looks like Mark Hammill/Harrison Ford/Carrie Fisher varies widely, especially if you include issue covers.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 3: Rebel Jail
item.description:
Backstory! Work Obi-Wan and Lukeâ€™s uncle. A prison hidden tucked right up against a sun. Hearding Nerfs. Sana, Leia, and Aphraâ€¦ working together?

Itâ€™s a decent enough adventure with quite the set pieces. I just wish I had more time in Obi-Wanâ€™s backstory now!

item.title: Vader Down
item.description:
And now things get complicatedâ€¦ Vader Down is a crossover between Star Wars (2015), Star Wars: Darth Vader (2015) and a single standalone issue. Itâ€™s a neat story, but out so I wish there were easier to read on Marvel Unlimitedâ€¦

Turns out Anakin can still flyâ€¦

Anyways, Vader is forced down. One thing leads to another and the Rebellion decides that an entire battalion might be needed to keep him down.

This may not be enough.

Itâ€™s nice to see Dr. Aphra again. Been a a bit. And oh the droids.

For as annoying as it is to switch from series to series, thatâ€™s quite an enjoyable story.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 2: Showdown on the Smuggler's Moon
item.description:
The continuing in between adventures of all our original trilogy friends!

Itâ€™s a fun one, a dueling pair of adventures and a bit of backstory bridging the original trilogy and the prequels. I think thatâ€™d be an interesting era to read more about. How exactly did things go so badly so quickly.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 1: Skywalker Strikes
item.description:
Let’s read another Marvel Star Wars series! This time, getting a bit away from Vadar, we have Star Wars (2015). Set (initially) right after A New Hope, we have the fallout of the (first) Death Star and the whole gang out on a variety of adventures!

Overall, it’s a fun start. I’m looking forward to seeing where they go from here!

item.title: Ultimate Comics Captain America
item.description:
Well thatâ€™s a thing.

No matter the universe, Marvel seems chock full of Super Soldiers. Hereâ€™s one more.

Given the subject matter, it could have used a bit more nuance. A bit more time to breathe. Captain America represents what America could have/should have been. Vietnam is anything but.

Onward!

item.title: X-Men: Battle of the Atom
item.description:
Taking a quick side trip to another line of comics as things mix a bit. Itâ€™s kind of bonkers how in the world youâ€™re supposed to keep track of everything with all of these crossovers. Which I suppose is the idea.

Anyways.

Timey whimey madness ensues, we get a Back to the Future moment, the X-Men go homeâ€¦ who are we kidding. Of course things go weirder.

Worth tracking down. Worth reading.

Man that was a ride.
